quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code?
 x=[‘ab‘,’cd’]
 for i in x:
	 i.upper()
 print(x)
quiz.reason: The function upper() does not modify a string in place, it returns a new string which isn’t being stored anywhere.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code?
 x = [‘ab’, ‘cd’]
 for i in x:
	 x.append(i.upper())
 print(x)
quiz.reason: The loop does not terminate as new elements are being added to the list in each iteration.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code?
 i = 1
 while True:
 if i%3 == 0:
	 break
 print(i)
 i + = 1
quiz.reason: SyntaxError, there shouldn’t be a space between + and = in +=.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code?
 i = 1
 while True:
	 if i%0O7 == 0:
	 \tbreak
	 print(i)
	 i += 1
quiz.reason: Control exits the loop when i becomes 7.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code?
 i = 5
 while True:
	 if i%0O11 == 0:
	 \tbreak
	 print(i)
	 i += 1
quiz.reason: 0O11  is an octal number.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code?
 i = 5
 while True:
	 if i%0O9 == 0:
	 \tbreak
	 print(i)
	 i += 1
quiz.reason: 9 isn’t allowed in an octal number.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code?
 i = 1
 while True:
	 if i%2 == 0:
	 \tbreak
	 print(i)
	 i += 2
quiz.reason: The loop does not terminate since i is never an even number.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code?
 i = 2
 while True:
	 if i%3 == 0:
	 break
	 print(i)
	 i += 2
quiz.reason: The numbers 2 and 4 are printed. The next value of i is 6 which is divisible by 3 and hence control exits the loop.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code?
 i = 1
 while False:
	 if i%2 == 0:
	 \tbreak
	 print(i)
	 i += 2
quiz.reason: Control does not enter the loop because of False.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code?
 True = False
 while True:
	 print(True)
	 break
quiz.reason: SyntaxError, True is a keyword and it’s value cannot be changed.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.reason: The else part is not executed if control breaks out of the loop.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code?
 i = 0
 while i < 3:
	 print(i)
	 i += 1
 else:
	 print(0)
quiz.reason: The else part is executed when the condition in the while statement is false.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code?
 x = “abcdef”
 while i in x:
	 print(i, end=“ ”)

options.a: a b c d e f

options.c: i i i i i i ...

quiz.reason: NameError, i is not defined.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code?
 x = “abcdef”
 i = “i”
 while i in x:
	 print(i, end=“ ”)

options.b: i i i i i i...

options.c: a b c d e f

quiz.reason: “i” is not in “abcdef”.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code?
 x = “abcdef”
 i = “a”
 while i in x:
 print(i, end = “ ”)

options.c: a a a a a a...

options.d: a b c d e f

quiz.reason: As the value of i or x isn’t changing, the condition will always evaluate to True.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code?
 x = “abcdef”
 i = ”a”
 while i in x:
	 print('i', end = “ ”)

options.b: i i i i i i...

options.c: a a a a a a...

options.d: a b c d e f

quiz.reason: Here i i i i i … printed continuously because as the value of i or x isn’t changing, the condition will always evaluate to True. But also here we use a citation marks on “i”, so, here i treated as a string, not like a variable.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code?
 x = “abcdef”
 i = ”a”
 while i in x:
	 x = x[:-1]
	 print(i, end = ” ”)

options.b: a a a a a a

quiz.reason: The string x is being shortened by one character in each iteration.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code?
 x = “abcdef”
 i = “a”
 while i in x[:-1]:
	 print(i, end = “ ”)

options.b: a a a a a a

options.c: a a a a a a...

quiz.reason: String x is not being altered and i is in x[:-1].

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code?
 x = “abcdef”
 i = “a”
 while i in x:
	 x = x[1:]
	 print(i, end = “ ”)

options.a: a a a a a a

quiz.reason: The string x is being shortened by one character in each iteration.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code?
 x = “abcdef”
 i = “a”
 while i in x[1:]:
	 print(i, end = “ ”)

options.a: a a a a a a

quiz.reason: i is not in x[1:].

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code?
 x = 'abcd'
 for i in x:
	 print(i)
	 x.upper()
quiz.reason: Changes do not happen in-place, rather a new instance of the string is returned.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code?
 x = 'abcd'
 for i in x:
	 print(i.upper())
quiz.reason: The instance of the string returned by upper() is being printed.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code?
 x = 'abcd'
 for i in range(x):
	 print(i)
quiz.reason: range(str) is not allowed.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code?
 x = 'abcd'
 for i in range(len(x)):
	 print(i)
quiz.reason: i takes values 0, 1, 2 and 3.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code?
 x = 'abcd'
 for i in range(len(x)):
	 print(i.upper())
quiz.reason: Objects of type int have no attribute upper().

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code snippet?
 x = 'abcd'
 for i in range(len(x)):
	 i.upper()
 print (x)
quiz.reason: Objects of type int have no attribute upper().

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code snippet?
 x = 'abcd'
 for i in range(len(x)):
	 x[i].upper()
 print (x)
quiz.reason: Changes do not happen in-place, rather a new instance of the string is returned.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code snippet?
 x = 'abcd'
 for i in range(len(x)):
	 i[x].upper()
 print (x)
quiz.reason: Objects of type int aren’t subscriptable. However, if the statement was x[i], an error would not have been thrown.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code snippet?
 x = 'abcd'
 for i in range(len(x)):
	 x = 'a'
	 print(x)
quiz.reason: range() is computed only at the time of entering the loop.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code snippet?
 x = 'abcd'
 for i in range(len(x)):
	 print(x)
	 x = 'a'
quiz.reason: abcd a a a is the output as x is modified only after ‘abcd’ has been printed once.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code?
 x = 123
 for i in x:
	 print(i)
quiz.reason: Objects of type int are not iterable.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.reason: Loops over the keys of the dictionary.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.reason: Error, objects of type int aren’t iterable.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.reason: Loops over key, value pairs.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.reason: Loops over the keys and prints the values.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.reason: Causes a KeyError.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.reason: Objects of type set have no attribute values.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.reason: Loops over the elements of the set and prints them.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.reason: Variable x takes the values 0, 1 and 2. set.add() returns None which is printed.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.reason: range(0) is empty.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.reason: range(int(2.0)) is the same as range(2).

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.reason: Error, objects of type float cannot be interpreted as an integer.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.reason: OverflowError, cannot convert float infinity to integer.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.reason: [::-1] reverses the list.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.reason: ‘ ‘.join(reversed(list(‘abcd’))) reverses a string.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.reason: [::-1] reverses the string.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.reason: The string does not have any character to loop over.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code snippet?
 x = 2
 for i in range(x):
	 x += 1
	 print (x)
quiz.reason: Variable x is incremented and printed twice.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code snippet?
 x = 2
 for i in range(x):
	 x -= 2
	 print (x)
quiz.reason: The loop is entered twice.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.reason: The else part is executed if control doesn’t break out of the loop.
